snippet: A new mobile service called Free isn't quite that, but analysts said it was considerably less expensive than packages offered by existing operators.
abstract: A new mobile service called Free isn't quite that, but analysts said it was considerably less expensive than packages offered by existing operators.
lead_paragraph: Iliad, which operates under the brand name Free, introduced on Tuesday a wireless service that challenges the three main mobile operators in France on price, reports Eric Pfanner. The new mobile service is built around a 19.99 euro plan that includes unlimited domestic and international calls, text messages and mobile data. Read more »

headline.main: A Low-Priced Rival Pushes to Take Over France's Mobile Phone Market
